content: by z/OS only. Other operating systems cannot use zIIPs, even if they are defined to the LPAR. z/VM V7R1 and later support real and virtual zIIPs to guest z/OS systems. LPAR mode PU type Operating systems PUs usage General CPs  z/Architecture operating systems  Linux on IBM Z CPs DED or CPs SHR CPs and zIIPs  z/OS  z/VM (guest exploitation) CPs DED or zIIPs DED or CPs SHR or zIIPs SHR General CPs z/TPF CPs DED or CPs SHR Coupling facility ICFs or CPs CFCC ICFs DED or ICFs SHR or CPs DED or CPs SHR Linux only IFLs or CPs  Linux on IBM Z  z/VM IFLs DED or IFLs SHR or CPs DED or CPs SHR z/VM CPs, IFLs, zIIPs, or ICFs z/VM (V7R1 and later) All PUs must be SHR or DED 122 IBM z16 (3931) Technical Guide Dynamically adding or deleting a logical partition name Dynamically adding or deleting an LPAR name is the ability to add or delete LPARs and their associated I/O resources to or from the configuration without a POR.
